content:
We need an Editor to take on these three important pages which have already been edited and improved, but have outstanding FIXME and some unresolved questions.

Manage Routes > Waypoints -Marks Tab
Manage Routes > Waypoint Properties
Manage Routes >Use Waypoint-Marks

Thank you.
@Manfred Radmacher Thank you for taking on the Waypoint Pages. If there is anything I can do to help, please let me know.

@Dave Register @Manfred Radmacher

Dave I sent an email to you about Waypoints vs Marks. We have been having a somewhat technical discussion about this to understand what we should do about simplifying for the User these terms, to be consistent it appears that it may involve changing a program menu "title" or two. To continue editing we need your review and direction. Please see the email. Thanks.

@Dave Register @Manfred Radmacher
Manfred is going to post some screenshots for changes to here for you to review regarding "Mark vs Waypoint" decision.

One example of these inconsistencies: when looking at the dialog box Options -> Ships -> Routes/Point , you will see that the word "waypoint" refers to two different navobjects:

Bildschirmfoto-2024-06-01-um-15.14.19.png

The instances circled in green refer to points, which are part of a route.
The instances circled in orange refer to objects, which have been created by "Drop Mark"

To me, it makes a lot of sense to call the one waypoint, since in a route "I am on my way to this point", and the other mark, since it marks a point of interest in the chart.

I am aware that the two objects have different names in navobj, however here I am just asking as a user to have a nomenclature, where different things are called differently.

I believe that waypoints and marks are nice and clear terms, which should then be used consistently throughout the entire user interface.

As a matter of fact, there are only a few instances, which ask for changes (in the GUI only I hope):

  • Route and Mark Manager -> WayPoint tab should be called Mark

Bildschirmfoto-2024-06-01-um-15.12.31.png

  • right click on a waypoint should open a menu with Mark in the title:

Bildschirmfoto-2024-06-01-um-15.13.27.png
Bildschirmfoto-2024-06-01-um-15.13.00.png

To corroborate this point, currently we have to write the following:
Drop mark creates a mark which is later on called waypoint. This shall not be confused with points in a route, which are also called waypoints. They look similar, but behave differently, even though waypoints (aka marks) can be added to routes as well. For instance, when deleting a route all waypoints of this route will be deleted, except those waypoints, who are actually marks.

Manfred
@Manfred Radmacher @Dave Register Manfred I like your approach, with respect to Marks and Waypoints. I hope Dave agrees.
In my charts, the VAST majority of marks are actually waypoints, so I tend to call them waypoints anyway.... But, I can see your point.

@Manfred Radmacher I've made many of the changes in the manual to Mark Tab, Mark Properties, and Use Marks. We will have to search and check and investigate:

  1. Links throughout back to Marks / Waypoints
  2. References to "waypoint" or " waypoints" in text, when it should perhaps be changed to "mark" or "marks". This will have to be done partly by hand, because it depends on context, when talking about a route I believe we should use "waypoints" Is that correct Manfred?

The review in Github Issues is here https://github.com/OpenCPN/OpenCPN/issues/3952
Now I see you've made some good comments there. Thanks.

I agree with the previous message.

Route points should be called waypoints throughout the wiki, since they are called waypoint in the GUI as well.

So, we have to look for all instances of "waypoint" in the wiki and determine if it needs renamig or not.

Is there a possibility to search for links to the three mark pages? This may be those instances requiring changes.

Good idea. Yes. Sent you an email. Another way to do this and get most of it is to Go through all the page under Manage Routes. Open the page, DWedit then in Windows execute "Find" Ctrl-F . In the lower right there will be a box. Type in there "waypoint" (not waypoints) Then look at the highlighted words. You can get "mark" into your clipboard and highlight the "waypoints" and just paste Ctrl-V each one that needs to be changed.

I think reading and doing this will each page so you get the context would be best.
I will do some tonight. Write the pages you've checked in Editor-Manual 2024 Status and Progress, as will I.
I would put "Marks" to indicate that it is done for that page.
